title: Bulls see blue sky in the cloud
text:
Amazon Web Sevices, Next DC and Megaport have painted a bullish outlook for the adoption of cloud-based platforms by Australian companies, highlighting the fast-paced takeup of capacity amid demands for cheaper, more flexible and scalable technology solutions.

The embrace of the cloud by businesses and government was only in its eartly stages, with Paul Migliorini, the head of Amazon Web Services in Australia and New Zealand, telling the Citi investment conference that migration to the cloud was "way less than 10 per cent".

"There's still a long way to go," he said.

It was a sentiment echoed by Steve Loxton, chief financial officer of ASX-listed Megaport, which offers connection services to the world's largest cloud providers.

"The US has been the innovator in terms of cloud where we're seeing the most rapid adoption of cloud. I've seen numbers of between 10 and 20 per cent in the US," he said.
description: Amazon Web Services, Next DC and Megaport are investing heavily in additional capacity to meet the accelerating demand for cloud-based platforms.
